# {{< meta topic >}}

## Where are We?

::: {style="font-size: 85%;"}
- `R` Basics
- Data Visualization
- [`R` Programming]{color="blue"}
  - [Statistical Analysis]{color="blue"}
- Tidy Data Manipulation
- `python` Basics
- Web Scraping with `python`

:::


## Goals for this Video

In this video: 

::: incremental

- Formula Syntax
- Classical Statistical Models with `R`
- Key Accessor Functions

:::


## Formula Notation

`R` was designed for statistical analysis (originally called `S`)

. . . 

Major contributions

- `data.frame` / tidy structure
- Formula language ("Wilkinson-Rogers notation")

## Formula Notation

In `R`, a `formula` is a special object defined by a `~`

. . . 

Most common structure

> `y ~ x1 + x2`

Predict variable `y` using `x1` and `x2`

. . . 

- Modern `R` uses formulas in many other contexts
- Various extensions provided by packages

## Modeling Functions

Basic modeling function: `lm` (_linear model_)




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(palmerpenguins)
lm(body_mass_g ~ flipper_length_mm, data=penguins)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Call:
lm(formula = body_mass_g ~ flipper_length_mm, data = penguins)

Coefficients:
      (Intercept)  flipper_length_mm  
         -5780.83              49.69  
```


:::
:::





## Modeling Functions




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
lm(body_mass_g ~ flipper_length_mm, data=penguins)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Call:
lm(formula = body_mass_g ~ flipper_length_mm, data = penguins)

Coefficients:
      (Intercept)  flipper_length_mm  
         -5780.83              49.69  
```


:::
:::




- Provide model (`formula`) and data (`data.frame`) instead of $X, y$
- By default automatically includes an intercept term

## Modeling Functions




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
lm(body_mass_g ~ flipper_length_mm + species, data=penguins)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Call:
lm(formula = body_mass_g ~ flipper_length_mm + species, data = penguins)

Coefficients:
      (Intercept)  flipper_length_mm   speciesChinstrap      speciesGentoo  
         -4031.48              40.71            -206.51             266.81  
```


:::
:::




Automatically: 

- Encodes categorical (`factor`) variables
  - `?C` for details
- Removes extra / redundant columns


## Modeling Functions




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
lm(body_mass_g ~ flipper_length_mm*bill_depth_mm, data=penguins)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Call:
lm(formula = body_mass_g ~ flipper_length_mm * bill_depth_mm, 
    data = penguins)

Coefficients:
                    (Intercept)                flipper_length_mm  
                     -36097.064                          196.074  
                  bill_depth_mm  flipper_length_mm:bill_depth_mm  
                       1771.796                           -8.596  
```


:::
:::




- `*` creates both 'main' effects and interactions


## Modeling Functions




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
lm(body_mass_g ~ flipper_length_mm*species, data=penguins)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Call:
lm(formula = body_mass_g ~ flipper_length_mm * species, data = penguins)

Coefficients:
                       (Intercept)                   flipper_length_mm  
                         -2535.837                              32.832  
                  speciesChinstrap                       speciesGentoo  
                          -501.359                           -4251.444  
flipper_length_mm:speciesChinstrap     flipper_length_mm:speciesGentoo  
                             1.742                              21.791  
```


:::
:::




- `*` of continuous and categorical creates ANCOVA

## Modeling Functions 

Many extensions




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(mgcv)
gam(body_mass_g ~ s(flipper_length_mm) + s(bill_depth_mm, by=species), data=penguins)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Family: gaussian 
Link function: identity 

Formula:
body_mass_g ~ s(flipper_length_mm) + s(bill_depth_mm, by = species)

Estimated degrees of freedom:
1.56 1.96 1.00 4.39  total = 9.91 

GCV score: 106441.7     
```


:::
:::



Fits a *mixed-effect non-linear regression*

## Accessors

Helper functions to access fitted models: 




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
m <- lm(body_mass_g ~ flipper_length_mm*bill_depth_mm + species, data=penguins)
coef(m)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
                    (Intercept)               flipper_length_mm 
                  -4844.4526376                      27.3153209 
                  bill_depth_mm                speciesChinstrap 
                    200.0652179                    -131.5598847 
                  speciesGentoo flipper_length_mm:bill_depth_mm 
                   1283.9149548                      -0.0900381 
```


:::
:::




## Accessors




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
summary(m)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Call:
lm(formula = body_mass_g ~ flipper_length_mm * bill_depth_mm + 
    species, data = penguins)

Residuals:
    Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max 
-900.40 -238.12  -40.12  228.86 1085.32 

Coefficients:
                                  Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept)                     -4.844e+03  5.298e+03  -0.914   0.3611    
flipper_length_mm                2.732e+01  2.699e+01   1.012   0.3123    
bill_depth_mm                    2.001e+02  2.945e+02   0.679   0.4973    
speciesChinstrap                -1.316e+02  5.192e+01  -2.534   0.0117 *  
speciesGentoo                    1.284e+03  1.572e+02   8.166 6.51e-15 ***
flipper_length_mm:bill_depth_mm -9.004e-02  1.495e+00  -0.060   0.9520    
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 331.3 on 336 degrees of freedom
  (2 observations deleted due to missingness)
Multiple R-squared:  0.8319,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.8294 
F-statistic: 332.5 on 5 and 336 DF,  p-value: < 2.2e-16
```


:::
:::

## Accessors

Out-of-sample / test prediction:




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
toppenguins <- penguins |> slice_max(body_mass_g, n=10)
predict(m, newdata=toppenguins)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
       1        2        3        4        5        6        7        8 
5214.684 5771.046 5387.019 5420.707 5482.561 5547.870 4898.577 5201.160 
       9       10       11 
5591.689 5601.704 5591.689 
```


:::
:::




## Accessors

For just `lm`: 




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
methods(class="lm")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
 [1] add1           alias          anova          case.names     coerce        
 [6] confint        cooks.distance deviance       dfbeta         dfbetas       
[11] drop1          dummy.coef     effects        extractAIC     family        
[16] formula        fortify        hatvalues      influence      initialize    
[21] kappa          labels         logLik         model.frame    model.matrix  
[26] nobs           plot           predict        print          proj          
[31] qqnorm         qr             residuals      rstandard      rstudent      
[36] show           simulate       slotsFromS3    summary        variable.names
[41] vcov          
see '?methods' for accessing help and source code
```


:::
:::




Even more for other models


## Looking Ahead

Your turn!

. . . 

Applications to course project: 

- Build models to _explore_ and _understand_ data


## Learning More

For more: 

- Additional STA and CIS classes
  - STA 9708: Basic Inferential Statistics
  - STA 9700: Regression (`lm` and similar)
  - and many more!
